meanings.sent1: Her forbearance in dealing with difficult customers is admirable.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate your forbearance while I finish my work.
meanings.sent3: His forbearance in waiting for the bus in the rain was tested.
meanings.sent4: The tree showed forbearance in bending but not breaking during the storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's forbearance towards the noisy students was remarkable.

meanings.definition: The action of refraining from exercising a legal right, especially enforcing the payment of a debt.
meanings.sent1: The bank showed forbearance by giving the borrower more time to repay the loan.
meanings.sent2: The landlord's forbearance in not evicting the tenant during tough times was appreciated.
meanings.sent3: The forbearance of the creditor allowed the debtor to catch up on payments.
meanings.sent4: The company's forbearance in not pursuing legal action saved time and resources.
meanings.sent5: The court's forbearance in granting an extension showed understanding of the situation.
